function.name: edit-tools-migration-guideline
function.arguments: {"from":"S3","migrateScenario":"migration from S3 to Azure Storage","to":"Azure Storage"}

messages.content:
There are several steps to complete scenario migration from S3 to Azure Storage 
1) Update the dependency files: Find the java dependency file in the project, include the pom.xml or gradle settings, update the dependency for scenario migration from S3 to Azure Storage from S3 to Azure Storage
 2) Update the Java Code: Search the java code in the whole project if any code is using the API from S3, if yes, replace it with Azure Storage 
 3) Update the configuration code:  Check the configuration files in the project, normally it is properties/yaml/yml files, check if it is still using the configuration of S3, if yes, replace it with the configuration of Azure Storage  
 4) Update the test cases: Check the test cases in the project, if any test case is using the API from ${from}, replace it with ${to} 
 5) Try the above steps multiple time and make sure all the code related with  ${from} 
  is changed to ${to}6) Compile the code and fix the build error

To migrate from S3 to Azure Storage, follow these steps:

1. **Update Dependencies**: Modify your `pom.xml` to include dependencies for Azure Storage and remove any S3 dependencies.
2. **Update Java Code**: Search for any S3 API usage in your Java code and replace it with Azure Storage API.
3. **Update Configuration**: Check your configuration files (e.g., `application.properties`) for S3 settings and replace them with Azure Storage settings.
4. **Update Test Cases**: Ensure that any test cases using S3 APIs are updated to use Azure Storage APIs.
5. **Compile and Fix Errors**: Compile your code and resolve any build errors that arise from the changes.

Let's start by updating the `pom.xml` file to include the Azure Storage dependency.

I see we have two main issues to fix:

1. There are duplicate dependencies in pom.xml (mockito-core, mockito-junit-jupiter, and spring-boot-starter-test)
2. The EventServiceTest.java file is incorrectly placed in the main source directory instead of the test directory

Let's first fix the duplicate dependencies in pom.xml:

function.name: edit_file
function.arguments:
{"code": "<dependencies>
    // ...existing dependencies...
    
    <!-- Test dependencies -->
    <dependency>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
        <scope>test</scope>
        <exclusions>
            <exclusion>
                <groupId>org.junit.vintage</groupId>
                <artifactId>junit-vintage-engine</artifactId>
            </exclusion>
        </exclusions>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
        <artifactId>junit-jupiter-engine</artifactId>
        <scope>test</scope>
    </dependency>
</dependencies>", "explanation": "Remove duplicate test dependencies and update to use spring-boot-starter-test which includes all necessary testing libraries", "filePath": "c:/projects/eventostec-backend/pom.xml"}
